revision.text:
{{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Red flag II.svg|thumb|[[Red flag]]s associated with [[socialism]]]] '''Political symbolism''' is symbolism that is used to represent a political standpoint. The symbolism can occur in various media including [[banners]], [[acronyms]], [[pictures]], [[flags]], [[mottos]], and countless more. For example, [[Red flag]]s have traditionally been flown by [[socialists]], [[left-wing]] radicals, and [[communist]] groups to represent the "blood of the workers". Black flags have traditionally been flown by [[anarchists|anarchism]], and [[left-wing]] radicals to represent the absence of all oppressive structures. A combination of the two colors in a black flag represents social anarchism, such as [[anarchist communism]] and [[anarcho syndicalism]].
Many groups use the [[political colour]] associated with their political philosophy, for example blue, particularly dark blue, is often associated with [[Conservative Party|Conservative parties]].
Cultural groups may use symbols in what many consider to be a political way, for example [[LGBT symbols]] like the [[Rainbow flag]] are used to promote the political goal of [[LGBT]] rights.
==See also== *[[Anarchist symbolism]] *[[Communist symbolism]] *[[Fascist symbolism]] *[[Nazi symbolism]] *[[List of political party symbols]] *[[List of symbols]]
